body: Ah, this one snuck in. @TylerCarlson1 I think this one was from the conventions PR, is the ToUpper in PascalCaseNamingConvention needed?

It's used so that if you have foo_bar in one class map to a class with foobar and FooBar, it will pick FooBar consistantly instead of foobar or FooBar based on the position of the property in the code.
So I thiiiiiink I'm going to make the default to be case insensitive? Then add case sensitive if you need it?
Sounds good, I guess.  If case insensitivity is the default that's fine.  Does Automapper need this kind of option in IConfiguration to set this, as well is having the option in DefaultName?
If you want it out ASAP then you can just replace DefaultName's code with CaseInsensitiveName's for now.

issue.title: 4.1.0 sets destination property to `null` when source property have multiple upper case letters

body:
I may be wrong but this bug fix does not take into account when you have specified member prefixes or postfixes. 

I modified the test case above to do an integration test using 4.1.0, and 4.1.1 and the prefix and postfix matching is applied when the properties are spelt exactly the same (e.g. ID -> test_ID) but not when the properties are spelt differently (e.g ID -> test_Id)

Same functionality works fine in 4.0.4 though

Did you change anything else besides adding prefix?  Like changing the Source or Destination name splitter from Pascal?   Was the prefix test or test_?

#900 Shows an issue with the Pascal Name Splitter and some weird edge cases.  This might be what's going on.
Prefixe and Postfixe logic has its own string comparison function inside of it, and it's Case sensitive.
Ok, I'll open another issue for this as the bug is to do with the prefix/postfix matching specifically

issue.title: Prefix/Postfix property matching is now case sensitive
issue.body:
Between 4.04 and 4.1.0 the prefix and postfix property name matching algoithm changed from being case insensitive to case sensitive.

Using the test case shown in #950, I expanded the test cases into an integration test  (added as comment to same issue) to include prefix and postfix destination values, so that I could easily point to different versions of Automapper.

Perhaps we should be allowed to state whether to use Case sensitive or Case Insensitive matching when also using prefix and postfix property pattern matching.

body:
I don't think this is fixed, is it ?
AutoMapper is still case sensitive. I see in the Release changelog for 4.2.0 "#955 Add case sensitivity option for DefaultName comparer" but I'm not sure how I can use this option.

And I can't do as suggested above :
`Mapper.Initialize(cfg => cfg.DefaultMemberConfig.AddName<CaseInsensitiveName>());`
There is no DefaultMemberConfig on cfg.

I tried with a profile, the property is there but it doesn't seem to do much.
Could you add something about case sensitivity in the wiki ?

Which version are you using?

Also with case sensitivity #1141 might be relevant if you are using Prefixes and Postfixes.

I am experiencing the same issue as @killergege when trying to map from a dynamic source object. The property names are the same between source and destination other than casing.

```
var account = await response.Content.ReadAsAsync<dynamic>();
var accountDTO = this.mapper.Map<Account.Api.Models.Account>(account);
```

I just realized as I was writing this that in my case I can map my object directly through the ReadAsAsync method without going through AutoMapper, but if that wasn't an option then I would be stuck.

`var account = await response.Content.ReadAsAsync<Account.Api.Models.Account>();`
